content.description: A super-steep route. It has two really hard boulder problems separated by a rest.
A 4-bolt extension of Pit Lizard tackling the big roof overhead.
content.protection: Bring your own draws for Pit Lizard, but the 4 draws of Space Lizard are pre-hung.
content.location: This route is an extension of Pit Lizard.

content.description: Slab to steep overhang. Short but powerful. Originally graded 12b, may be as easy as 11d now due to Deep Creek's constant evolution. (Polite way of saying choss falls off the routes every spring)
Hard 11-ish climbing down low leads to a pumpy, tough roof, then it mellows out a bit to the chains.
content.location: Just right of Pit Lizard. It's the furthest right of the three climbs under the big triangular roof in the center section of the pit.

content.description: Certainly one of the best 11a's in the area. It's a juggy climb with no really hard moves. The pump will get you though.
content.location: 6th bolted line from the left at The Pit.

content.description:
Direct Start to Pit Boss. Start with the first 2 bolts clipped (short chain and cable draw) before pulling a steep boulder problem out of the cave. Theoretically if you can do these moves, the rest of the route should be a cake walk.

After the boulder problem, rest at the second roof and continue as for Pit Boss.
content.location: Starts in the steepest section of the cave on the right side of the pit. Â There is a comfortable looking alcove with a bolt line above that marks the start

content.description: Starts to the right of big papa pump and traverses two bolts into the first rough. The direct start adds a V9/10 boulder problem and goes at 13d
content.location: Third bolt line from the right

content.description: Climbs through the lower crux of Flip a Bitch Bear, then heads left to the top. There is a two bolt anchor at the 9th bolt - if you stop here it's around 13d.
content.protection: Mix of fixed draws and personal nylon draws
content.location: Shares the start with Flip a Bitch Bear, L side of the Pit.

content.description: Sustained climbing with two bouldery cruxes.  Saving strength for the V5 boulder problem before the chains is the key to sending.

This is a long, juggy route with a traditional feel. You get some fun arete climbing in a cool position, Interesting traverses, a few good rests, then the climb is finished with a difficult undercling to a very long, tricky reach over a bulge. The climb is quite easy till the finish, which seems much harder than other mid-11's at the creek. Perhaps the rockfall of 06-07 left the finish a bit harder? Or maybe I was climbing like a Nancy-boy last Tuesday? Your feedback will be appreciated... or not.
content.location: The Pit- walk from the left-hand side till you get to something that looks like a normal human could climb it... (about the fourth bolt line).

content.description: Slab to a steep roof
Climb past the chains of Gravalanche to a steep finish.
content.location: Far left end of the Pit wall.

content.description: Fun movement and poor rock quality. You should be careful of loose rock in the initial corner but past that all the important holds are secure. No definitive crux, just moderate climbing the whole way.
content.protection: 8 bolts and lower-offs at the anchor.
content.location: far left on the Pit wall.

content.description: A long route with a couple cruxes. One is at the fifth bolt, after you leave the ledge. There is another hard move after the 9th bolt, just before the chains. This climb has a reputation as having a very difficult clipping hold at the chains, but I found the move to be very reasonable. The fall is also quite safe if you run out of steam, with a bolt right at your feet. I think the clipping position used to be worse. At any rate, I thought the route to be one of the best 11's at the creek, better than any at Main Wall. Give it a try!
content.location: The Pit- just to the left of the big inside corner, under the big triangular roof.

content.description: This is a link-up of Fresh Produce and Long Neglect. Start on Long Neglect, the super juggy climb close to and on the arete. At the second ledge, traverse right into Fresh Produce. I think it links the best parts of both climbs and creates a really fun climb that is actually a pretty good warm-up, 'cause it starts out with big holds and has 3 great rest stances. You also get an exciting finish with a very well-protected crux!
content.location: Start on Long neglect, which is basically the first line you come to (from L to R) that you could possibly think is 5.11 at the pit.

content.description:
This long sustained pumpy route, has a few cruxes with thought provoking technical movement.

* Near the 3rd bolt a previously glued in hold appears to of been removed or broke off.  It is possible that this has increased the difficulty slightly, as the routes 1st crux is moving to the missing hold. **
content.location: To the left of the classic (8) Pit Lizard

content.description: Shares the first five bolts of the hard classic MÃ¶tley Crux, then moves right.
content.protection: Fixed draws for the first half, personal draws for the headwall
content.location: Left side of the pit. Start on MÃ¶tley.

content.description: Boulder problem start on the corner, then finishes on ChangingTo Shadows.
a bouldery climb out the roof bulge to headwall above.
This is a fun route that starts out kind of cruxy then turns into a jug haul to the chains
content.location: just right of the open book, which is right of the big triangular "Pit Lizard" roof
